revised_title: Discovery of Palladium and Other Substances Found with Platina
tldr: The author, William Hyde Wollaston, discovered palladium, a new metallic element, while analyzing the ore of platina. He also found other interesting substances, such as iridium and osmium, and made observations on the ruby-like crystals found in the ore. Wollaston's experiments led him to consider palladium as a new simple metal and he named it after the planet discovered by Dr. Olbers.
